level.text: DCPS may refer a student discipline case to OAH, for an Administrative Law Judge to hold a hearing and to decide:

Whether required due process procedures, including notice and the opportunity to respond to the charges, have been followed or have been waived, including whether there was prejudicial failure to follow procedures identified in 5 DCMR B § 2505; and
Whether the facts show that the student committed any of the violations upon which a proposed disciplinary action is based and the proper Tier for any violation, as specified in 5 DCMR B § 2502.

DCPS shall refer a student discipline case by filing with OAH a copy of the notice of recommended action provided to the adult student, or a minor student’s parent or guardian. The hearing notice shall contain the hearing date and state the consequences of failing to attend the hearing.
